intro: Cynorkis tenuicalcar subsp. onivensis, commonly known as the Onivense Cynorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its slender, leafy stems and small, delicate flowers that often display a range of colors. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
